name: templatebot.render_ready_v1
doc: Message sent to templatebot from helper microservices once a GitHub repository has been provisioned (as an action of a prerender message).

fields.name: github_repo
fields.doc: URL of the newly-created GitHub repository, ready to push an initial commit into.

fields.name: template_name
fields.doc: Name of the template (directory name) in the template repo.

fields.name: variables
fields.doc: Values of cookiecutter variables set by a user, and possibly updated by the helper microservice during the prerender phase.

fields.name: template_repo
fields.doc: URL of the template repository (https://github.com/lsst/templates, for example).

fields.name: template_repo_ref
fields.doc: Git ref of the template repository (branch, tag, or commit SHA).

fields.name: retry_count
fields.doc: Current number of retries, including this message. The initial message has a retry_count of 0.

fields.name: initial_timestamp
fields.doc: Timestamp of the initial message (when retry_count==0). Use this timestamp to understand how long the work has been in the retry loop.

fields.name: slack_username
fields.doc: Username of the Slack user initiating the action. null if the action did not originate from Slack.

fields.name: slack_thread_ts
fields.doc: Timestamp of a Slack message. Send status messages as threaded replies to that message. null if the action did not originate from Slack.

fields.name: slack_channel
fields.doc: ID of the Slack channel to post in. null if the action did not originate from Slack.
